intro: Metastelma paraquense, commonly known as the Paraquense Metastelma, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and purple. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in warm, humid climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
